info.name: Poool API & Webhooks
info.description: Developer guide to the Poool API & Webhooks. <aside class="warning">Beta version - endpoints and responses are subject to change.</aside>

item.name: 01 Getting started
item.description: Your first steps with the Poool API & Webhooks

item.name: Poool API & Webhooks - Terms and Security

request.description:
Poool API & Webhooks are powerful tools. Protecting your API Token and using the API responsibly is essential to ensure the security of your data and systems.
Permissions Poool API Tokens are NOT tied to the same permissions as Poool Application Users and Roles. When creating an API Token, you choose from a special set of permissions granted to the Poool API Token in your current Poool instance. Any extra protections like 2FA, SSO and password policies do NOT apply to API Tokens. Data Risks and Responsibilities You are fully responsible for all actions performed using the Poool API & Webhooks. The Poool API & Webhooks allows operations that can create, update, delete, or otherwise manipulate your data. Any action performed using your API Token is considered authorized by you. Misuse of the Poool API and Webhooks can lead to accidental or intentional data destruction. Be cautious when granting access or performing bulk operations. Keep Your API Token Private The API Token is like a password to your Poool data. It provides access to the API and must be kept confidential. Never hardcode your token in public repositories or share it openly in emails, forums, or chats. Third-Party Usage If you need to provide access to third-party services, ensure they are reputable and trusted. Revoke or regenerate your token if you suspect it has been compromised.
